title: Capturing electronic patient reported outcomes in oncology practice. - ASCO Publications

summary.text: **Efficient Data Collection**: The article highlights the importance of integrating electronic patient reported outcomes (ePRO) into oncology practice to streamline data collection processes, enhancing efficiency for both patients and healthcare providers.

**Improved Patient Engagement**: By implementing ePRO tools, oncology practices can significantly improve patient engagement and satisfaction by providing a more personalized care experience, encouraging patients to actively participate in their treatment journey.

**Enhanced Clinical Decision-Making**: The use of ePRO data allows for real-time monitoring of patient-reported symptoms and quality-of-life metrics, enabling oncologists to make informed clinical decisions that can lead to improved patient outcomes and timely interventions.
